DOC.brief_title: Innovative Delivery Evidence Based Psychotherapy Women With Military Sexual Trauma
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose project test , use mixed qualitative quantitative assessment strategy , efficacy PE deliver via home-based telehealth ( PE-HBT ) versus PE deliver via standard service delivery ( PE-SD ) use randomize , group , repeat measure design . Objective 1 : To compare , post , 3 6-month follow-up , whether PE-HBT superior PE-SD across critical clinical quality life outcome ( i.e. , PTSD , depression , quality life ) due increase PE 'dosing ' result improved session attendance reduce attrition . Hypothesis 1 : In intent-to-treat analysis , PE-HBT effective PE-SD improve clinical quality life outcomes post , 3 , 6-month follow-up ; improvement correlate session attendance , high PE-HBT . Objective 2 : To compare post-intervention whether PE-HBT superior PE-SD across critical process outcome ( e.g. , session attendance , satisfaction , treatment adherence ) . Hypothesis 2 : PE-HBT yield well process outcomes PE-SD post-intervention . Exploratory Aims : ( 1 ) To determine treatment adherence process variable mediate relationship treatment condition clinical quality life outcomes note Objective 1 ; ( 2 ) To use qualitative interview method obtain data Veterans ' reaction , preference , difficulty , suggestion MST service .
